Honey Glazed Chicken

Jump to Recipe

Are you ready to elevate your dinner game with a dish that combines sweet and savory flavors in the most delightful way? Honey Glazed Chicken is the answer! This simple yet delicious recipe is perfect for weeknight dinners, special occasions, or even meal prep. With just a handful of ingredients, including succulent chicken breasts, rich honey, and a hint of garlic, this dish is both easy to make and incredibly satisfying. The honey glaze not only adds a beautiful caramelized finish but also infuses the chicken with a mouthwatering flavor that's sure to impress your family and friends. Plus, it's a healthy option packed with protein! In this article, we'll guide you through each step to create a perfectly baked Honey Glazed Chicken that’s bursting with flavor. Get ready to discover how this quick recipe can become a staple in your kitchen!

Ingredients

chicken breasts

Choose boneless, skinless chicken breasts for easy cooking and even flavor absorption. If you prefer, you can substitute with chicken thighs for a juicier result or use tofu for a vegetarian option. Marinate the chicken for at least 30 minutes before baking to enhance flavor.

honey

Use a high-quality, pure honey for the best flavor. If you need a substitute, maple syrup or agave nectar can work well, but they will alter the taste slightly. To enhance the honey's flavor, consider adding a touch of lemon juice or zest.

soy sauce

Opt for low-sodium soy sauce if you want to control the salt content. Tamari is a great gluten-free option. For a different flavor profile, try coconut aminos or liquid aminos as substitutes.

garlic (minced)

Fresh minced garlic is best, but you can use garlic powder as a substitute (1/8 teaspoon per clove). To enhance the flavor, consider roasting the garlic before adding it to the marinade.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil provides the best flavor. You can substitute with avocado oil or melted coconut oil. If you want to add more flavor, infuse the oil with herbs or spices before using.

salt

Use kosher salt for better control over seasoning. If you're watching sodium intake, consider using herbs and spices to enhance flavor without adding salt.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper will give the best flavor. If you want to add a kick, consider using freshly ground white pepper or a pinch of cayenne pepper for some heat.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Set your oven to 375°F (190°C) to ensure it’s hot enough for even cooking. This temperature is ideal for baking chicken, resulting in juicy meat.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Honey Mixture

    In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup of honey, 2 tablespoons of soy sauce, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Add salt and pepper to taste. Mix well until the ingredients are fully blended. This mixture will serve as both a marinade and a glaze, infusing the chicken with flavor.

  • Step 3: Coat the Chicken

    Take 2 pieces of chicken breasts and place them in a baking dish. Pour the honey mixture over the chicken, ensuring all surfaces are well coated. For an even better flavor, consider marinating the chicken in the honey mixture for 30 minutes to an hour before baking.

  • Step 4: Bake the Chicken

    Put the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes. The chicken is done when it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C) and is no longer pink in the center. Use a meat thermometer for accurate results.

  • Step 5: Baste the Chicken

    Halfway through the cooking process, take the chicken out and baste it with the glaze from the bottom of the baking dish. This helps to enhance the flavor and keeps the chicken moist.

  • Step 6: Rest and Serve

    Once baked, remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 5 minutes before serving. This allows the juices to redistribute, making for a juicier chicken. Serve with your favorite sides!

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to prepare chicken breasts before cooking?

Start by rinsing the chicken breasts under cold water and patting them dry with paper towels. This ensures they are clean and helps the glaze stick better. If the breasts are uneven in thickness, consider pounding them to an even thickness for more consistent cooking.

How do I know when the chicken is fully cooked?

Chicken is fully cooked when it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C). Use a meat thermometer to check the thickest part of the breast. If you don’t have a thermometer, cut into the chicken; the juices should run clear and the meat should no longer be pink.

Can I use other types of chicken besides breasts?

Absolutely! You can use thighs, drumsticks, or even whole chicken. Just adjust the cooking time according to the cut; dark meat generally takes longer to cook.

What if I don't have honey?

If you don't have honey, you can substitute it with maple syrup or agave nectar for a similar sweetness. You can also consider brown sugar mixed with a little water if you want a thicker glaze.

What is the purpose of basting the chicken?

Basting the chicken helps to keep it moist and infuses it with more flavor from the glaze. Use a spoon or baster to drizzle the glaze over the chicken halfway through cooking.

How can I make the dish healthier?

You can use skinless chicken breasts to reduce fat. Additionally, using low-sodium soy sauce can help reduce the sodium content. You can also serve it with steamed vegetables or a fresh salad for a balanced meal.

What should I do if I don’t have an oven?

You can cook the honey glazed chicken on the stovetop. Heat a skillet over medium heat, add a little olive oil, and cook the chicken for about 6-7 minutes on each side, pouring the glaze over it as it cooks.

How can I enhance the flavor of the glaze?

Consider adding a splash of apple cider vinegar or lime juice to the glaze for acidity, or incorporating spices like ginger or chili flakes for a kick. Fresh herbs such as thyme or rosemary can also add wonderful flavor.

What can I serve with honey glazed chicken?

This dish pairs well with rice, quinoa, or roasted vegetables. You can also serve it with a simple side salad or mashed potatoes for a complete meal.

What is the best way to store leftovers?

Let the chicken cool completely before transferring it to an airtight container. It can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in the oven or microwave before serving.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish is naturally gluten-free if you use a gluten-free soy sauce alternative, making it suitable for those with gluten sensitivities. For a lower-carb option, serve the chicken with grilled vegetables instead of rice. Additionally, it can easily be adapted for a dairy-free diet, as it contains no dairy products.

Pairings

For an ideal pairing, serve the Honey Glazed Chicken with steamed jasmine rice or fluffy quinoa, which will absorb the delicious glaze. Roasted vegetables like asparagus or glazed carrots add color and complement the sweetness of the chicken. For a beverage, a lightly chilled Sauvignon Blanc or a refreshing iced tea with lemon would enhance the meal beautifully.

Serving Suggestions

When serving, arrange the chicken breasts on a platter, drizzling any remaining glaze from the baking dish over the top. Garnish with fresh herbs such as parsley or cilantro for a pop of color. Pair with a side salad featuring mixed greens, sliced almonds, and a light vinaigrette to balance the sweetness of the chicken. Consider serving warm crusty bread on the side to soak up the delicious juices.

#

Honey Glazed Chicken

40 min
$8.5
350 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 2

Dietary Tags:

Gluten-FreeDairy-Free

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Main Course

Tags:

EasyQuickHealthyMain Course

Description

Tender chicken glazed with a sweet honey sauce that's quick and easy to make!

Ingredients

  • chicken breasts: 2 pieces
  • honey: 1/4 cup
  • soy sauce: 2 tablespoons
  • garlic (minced): 2 cloves
  • olive oil: 1 tablespoon
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste

11/22/2024
